item.title: Fuel Quantity Processor Channels – Honeywell FQIS

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, one channel may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Total fuel quantity is determined by measuring sticks or other acceptable means after each refueling, and agrees with fuel quantity indications,
Inoperative channel is deactivated by an acceptable procedure,
All flight deck fuel indications are operative,
For non-PIP and non-Pegasus FMCs, both EICAS computers are operative,
Fuel flow indications are operative,
FMC TOTALIZER FUEL quantity agrees with the fuel quantity indications, and
For Pegasus FMCs with Operational Program Software part number 3418 HNP-02C-08 or earlier, Thrust Management System is operative.

Prior to each engine start, confirm that on the FMC Performance Initialization Page FUEL is automatically initialized with the known total fuel quantity. If not, (i.e., boxes appear), DO NOT manually enter fuel quantity; repairs must be made before dispatch.
Prior to each engine start, confirm that fuel flow system inputs are valid on the FMC SENSOR STATUS Page 1 (LEFT and RIGHT FUEL FLO).

placard.para: Placard Fuel Quantity Module on the P5 panel "PROCESSOR CHANNEL _____ - INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Isolate and deactivate the malfunctioning channel with the following procedure.
Apply electrical power per Maintenance Manual 24-22-00. Close the battery (11C34) and RIGHT DC BUS (11L19) circuit breakers.
Close the fueling panel door.
Check that all EICAS circuit breakers are closed.

Press ECS/MSG pushbutton on the P61 panel. If the FUEL QTY BITE EICAS message is present, conduct a F.Q.I.S. fault detection BITE check per Maintenance Manual 28-41-00. If the message is not present, skip to step E.
If any codes A1 through A5 are displayed, the fault is in channel 1. If any codes B1 through B5 are displayed, the fault is in channel 2.

note.para: If faults exist in both channels, dispatch is not permitted.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the faulted channel;
If the fault is in channel 1, open the FUEL QTY 1 circuit breaker (11C34), and the FUEL QTY circuit breaker (34A10).
If the fault is in channel 2, open the FUEL QTY 2 circuit breaker (11L19) and the FUELING QTY circuit breaker (6E4).
Proceed to step 2.
If in step D the FUEL QTY BITE EICAS message is not present, conduct the following test.

note.para: It is preferable that this test be performed with less than 15,000 lbs total fuel.

numlitem.para: Open the FUEL QTY 1 (11C34) and FUEL QTY 2 (11L19) circuit breakers.
Verify that the FUEL QTY displays have gone blank.

note.para: If the displays do not blank, verify fueling door closed.

numlitem.para: Close FUEL QTY 1 circuit breaker (11C34), wait 10 seconds, and record the indicated fuel quantities for each tank; this tests channel 1.
Open FUEL QTY 1 circuit breaker (11C34) and then close FUEL QTY 2 circuit breaker (11L19), wait 10 seconds. Record the indicated fuel quantity in each tank; this tests channel 2.

Compare the quantities recorded in steps (3) and (4). If they differ by more than 400 lbs for any tank, determine the actual fuel in each tank by using the Measuring Sticks; reference UPS Fueling Manual B757 Section.
Using the deactivation procedures in step D(2), deactivate the channel which has the larger difference from the actual fuel quantity.
Fuel the aircraft normally on ground power.

note.para: Do not refuel on battery power with one channel inoperative.

numlitem.para: After each fueling, verify the accuracy of the operative channel with the following procedure:
With the fueling door closed, cycle the power on the active channel by opening the affected FUEL QTY 1 (11C34) or FUEL QTY 2 (11L19) circuit breaker for 10 seconds and then closing it.
With the measuring sticks, determine the actual quantity of fuel in each tank; reference UPS Fueling Manual B757 Section.
Compare the measuring stick quantity with the indicator quantity for each tank. The channel is operating normally if the stick quantity and indicator quantity values are within the following limits:
